text: hi guys I'm Lindsey strand and today on
sweet talk I'm making a peanut butter
and jelly milkshake PB&J was one of my
absolute favorite sandwiches as a kid so
I thought it'd be fun to turn it into a
fun and easy dessert so I'm starting
with two tablespoons of Concord grape
jelly on a burner I'm just trying to
heat this a little bit to loosen it up
so you can go on medium-low I might turn
it up a little bit here Concord grape is
kind of the classic PB&J flavor but if
you have another favorite maybe
raspberry or blueberry strawberry you
could definitely use that too you just
want to make sure you have one that's
smooth or you strain it out you could
heat this up in the microwave to just
make sure you go in 10 or 15 second
increments and whisk in between so that
you don't end up caramelizing your jelly
alright so this looks good it's nice and
smooth so I'm going to transfer this
into a piping bag you could definitely
use a ziploc instead I'm just gonna snip
all in the end of the piping bag here I
have my milkshake glass this has been
chilling in the freezer this is gonna
help the jelly stay on the sides so what
I'm gonna do is pipe along the edges of
the glass and just let it drip down so
we're creating little stripes and the
jelly adheres to the glass since it's
chilled giving it a fun design and then
you get a little bit of jelly in the
bottom as a treat at the end of your
milkshake that's good so now that I have
my glass ready I'm gonna pop this in the
freezer for about 30 minutes to set up
so my glass has been chilling for a
while so I'm ready to start my milkshake
so here I have a pint of vanilla ice
cream and to that I'm adding a quarter
cup of peanut butter powder and this was
actually the inspiration for this
milkshake because I haven't seen peanut
butter powder pop up everywhere and I
was like what is that I thought it would
be really fun
to make something with all of that
peanut flavor but none of the stickiness
of peanut butter I just added a third of
a cup of whole milk and that's it I'm
ready to blend
just like that we have our milkshake so
now I'm gonna grab my glass out of the
freezer alright ready to have my
milkshake alright that looks delicious
it smells like a PB&J it's a good sign
and now to finish it off I'm gonna top
it with a little bit of lightly
sweetened whipped cream now it's kind of
inspired by those crazy milkshakes you
see everywhere right now this one's a
little bit pared down it's simpler you
don't need quite so many ingredients
crazy accoutrements it's just a PB&J
milkshake but there is one final touch
and this is courtesy of an awesome
pastry chef I worked for Steven he had
buttered toast on one of his desserts
and I just thought it was absolutely
genius so this is just toasted white
bread of course because what kid didn't
want white bread for their PB&J I'm a
little bit of flaky sea salt just tear
it in half
pop tenon is your garnish grab your
straw and just like that it's your PB
and J milkshake it's full of nostalgia
it tastes delicious and it's another use
for peanut butter powder enjoy
[Music]
you
